March 29, 1967
Mr. Martin Busch
Director, mso
University of South Dakota
Vermillion, South Dakota 57069
Dear Marty*
As I discussed with you during your last visit to
Washington, 1 am hopeful that we can really do some
good in a very tangible way for educational radio
in the midwest during the coming months* This belief
is strengthened, obviously, by President Johnson's
Educational Message and the introduction of the Public
Television Act of 1967 by Senator Magnuson in the Senate
and CampS*amanTWarley Staggers in the House of Repre¬
sentatives* For the first time, educational radio is a
part of the package t
As you know, HER is in the final stages of completing
a major research project on the needs and status of
educational radio in the United States* This project
will result in a Report, perhaps as comprehensive in
its own way as the Carnegie Report was for ETV. It
will serve as the basis for documenting educational
radio*s case before Congress* Hearing dates have been
set for April 11#
In short, I need help—I need your help—and 2 need
it as soon as possible* In a ©ament of weakness, you
offered to help me in this crucial undertaking in any
appropriate way* Since I believe you implicitly, I
respectfully request the pleasure of your coc^pany at
the MA£B headquarters in Washington for as many hours
and days you can find (hopefully in the next week or
two) to aid in the analysis of material as it relates
particularly to the midwestern states.
I share with you the concern that our research efforts
be as fair and complete as possible* As you are well
aware, it is only because staff and financial limitations
are so tight on the radio side of our organisation
that I make this unusual plea at this time*
